item.title: Residents Behaviour, 12th December
item.description:
Another example of residents behaviour and attitude towards the estate. They show absolutely no regard for the quality of the environment and can be seen regularly just carrying items of furniture, rubbish bags full of food and clinical waste and all other manner of materials to this location. This is not commercial builders, this is the behaviour of long-standing residents. Your rules say not to identify or accuse others, but that is the core problem. The residents are getting away with poor behaviour because people are scared to stand up to them. This is why the council should intervene and either install CCTV or threaten people with fines. Many of the people I have witnessed fly tipping have vehicles (some even have vans) and could take their items to the recycling centre which is no more than 20 minutes away - and available free of charge. The council is providing a service at the expense of the tax payer instead of dealing with the core problem - unacceptable behaviour by grown adults.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Deventer Crescent, Dulwich Village, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Residents fly tipping every single day, 12th December
item.description:
Dear Southwark Council, I am writing to express my serious concern and disgust at the ongoing behaviour of residents on our estate, as shown in the images attached. The level of rubbish, fly-tipping and general disregard for the environment is completely unacceptable. It is creating a clear public health hazard and making the estate an unpleasant and unsafe place to live. What makes this even more frustrating is the contrast between how quickly the council issues fines for driving infractions on the estate, yet appears to take no meaningful action to address this far more serious and persistent problem. It is difficult to understand how such outrageous behaviour by residents has been allowed to continue unchecked. We expect the council to get a grip on this situation. At a minimum, this should include installing CCTV on the estate to deter ongoing abuse, and taking active steps to ensure residents behave responsibly and comply with basic standards of cleanliness. We urge you to take immediate and practical action before the situation deteriorates further.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Deventer Crescent, Dulwich Village, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken glass on crossing island, 12th December
item.description:

item.title: Burned out motorbike, 12th December
item.description:
Someone has set fire to a motorbike/moped and dumped it at the side of the road. There is debris, and damage to the tarmac where the road has been burned. This happened three or four days ago - 8 or 9 December. It just needs a quick clean up job please: and remove the motorbike. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Palace Road, Streatham Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: MP and councillor alerted to tipping at charity bin, 12th December
item.description:
Lots of reports since 2024 but it still happens. Charity says it empties regularly but even if true it cannot stop the associated illegal dumping Charity is provided by Southwark, according to the bin. Sort it now! Iâ€™m reporting to press and MP. Thank you-we do not want vermin and maggots.
